intro: Sorengia prionitis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sorrel, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are typically greenish-white in color. Sorengia prionitis is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
